snippet: Disclosure of the proposal set off political recriminations and questions on Sunday about President Obama’s promise to allow bipartisan Congressional talks to take precedence.
abstract: Plan by Pres Obama for immigration system overhaul would put illegal immigrants on path to citizenship that could start after about eight years and would require them to go to the back of the line behind legal applicants; plan includes shortened path to citizenship for young illegal immigrants who came to United States as children; disclosure of proposal sets off political recriminations and questions about Obama's promise to allow bipartisan Congressional talks to take precedence.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIA PRESTON
byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear reported from Washington, and Julia Preston from Hoboken, N.J.

lead_paragraph: Disclosure of the proposal set off political recriminations and questions on Sunday about President Obama’s promise to allow bipartisan Congressional talks to take precedence.

headline.seo: Obama Plan Envisions 8-Year Wait for Illegal Immigrants
headline.main: Obama’s Plan Sees 8-Year Wait for Illegal Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Plan Sets Long Line For Citizenship
